intro: Serratula transsylvanica, commonly known as the Transylvanian sowthistle, is a flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. Its leaves are hairy and have a serrated edge, while its yellow flowers bloom in the summer. Serratula transsylvanica is often considered a weed but has historical uses in traditional medicine.
